Inst, Pasteur/Virol. 1987, 138, 263-268 ENQUETESEROLOGIQUE PAR IMMUNOFLUORESCENCE INDIRECTE, SUR LES INFECTIONS A CORONAVIRUS OC 43 par M. Chambon (I), H. Laveran (2), R. L'Haridon (3), H. Peigue-Lafeuille (4), M. Trimolet (4) et D. Beytout (2) SUMMARY SEROEPIDEMIOLOOIC SURVEY OF CORONAVIRUS (STRAIN OC 43 ) INFECTIONS BY INDIRECT IMMUNOFLUORESCENCE Four-hundred seventy-two sera were examined by the indirect immunofluorescence test against coronavirus strain OC 43 adapted to the HRT l 8 cell culture. Sera were from children and adults hospitalized over a 4-year period, from 1979 to 1982, at the CHRU of Clermont-Ferrand (France) for different clinical reasons. Of the 446 sera tested, 61 % showed antibodies against OC 43 ; 90 0J0 of adult sera were positive. Coronavirus infections are very common in France. Immunity appears early in life, and infection is frequent in children from 12-36 months of age. KEY-WORDS: Coronavirus, Immunofluorescence; Diagnosis, Seroepidemiology. Manuscrit recu Ie 15 septembre 1986, accepte Ie 15 decembre 1986.

SUR LES INFECTIONS A CORONAVIRUS OC 43 par M. Chambon ( I ) ,

M. Trimolet ( 4 ) et D. Beytout ( 2 ) SUMMARY SEROEPIDEMIOLOOIC SURVEY OF CORONAVIRUS ( STRAIN OC 43 ) INFECTIONS BY INDIRECT IMMUNOFLUORESCENCE Four-hundred seventy-two sera were examined by the indirect immunofluorescence test against coronavirus strain OC 43 adapted to the HRT l 8 cell culture .
Sera were from children and adults hospitalized over a 4-year period ,
from 1979 to 1982 , at the CHRU of Clermont-Ferrand ( France ) for different clinical reasons .
61 % showed antibodies against OC 43 ; 90 0J0 of adult sera were positive .
Coronavirus infections are very common in France .
and infection is frequent in children from 12-36 months of age .
